Class ImageVisualizer

  • java.lang.Object
    • ImageVisualizer

  • public class ImageVisualizer
extends java.lang.Object
    A class that can view arbitrary image files in hex or binary
    Version:
    October 22, 2017, 12:23 A.M
    Author:
    Cameron Zurmuhl

      Method convertToAssemblyHex() converts a hexadecimal instruction to LEGv8 assembly

      Method getMem() returns the main memory

      Method isHex() returns whether the memory should be displayed in hex or binary

      Function memoryDisplayBin() returns a string formated to display memory from 0x0 down in binary

      Function memoryDisplayHex() returns a string formated to display memory from 0x0 down in hex Binary or hex depends on the input

      Method processHeader() processes the first line in the image file

      • ImageVisualizer

        public ImageVisualizer(java.lang.String fileName,
                       boolean hex,
                       int start,
                       int end)
        Constructor for objects of class Viewer
        Parameters:
        fileName - the name of the image file to visualize
        hex - whether the viewer is to report hex or binary
        start - the starting position in memory to visualize
        end - the ending position in memory to visualize
